Author: iris8600
Content: Hello, what's the best way to convert a `FieldElement` from starknet-rs to an hexadecimal string ?

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: `format!("{:x}", felt);`

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: or `format!("{:064x}")` if you want 64 chars

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: or `format!("{:#x}")` to get the `0x` prefix

Author: iris8600
Content: thanks !

Author: s4msepi0l#5603
_dsi
Content:
Hey guys, am I the only one having this error ? 

```
the method `get_block_number` exists for reference `&SequencerGatewayProvider`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
`SequencerGatewayProvider: Middleware`
which is required by `&SequencerGatewayProvider: Middleware`
```

I'm just trying to get the latest `block_number` from the sequencer

Author: _dsi
Content: Might be because I'm mixing Ethereum and StarkNet providers in my script but the StarkNet provider doesn't seem to have any Middleware implementation, only Ethereum providers

Author: supernovahs
Content: View tx worked

Author: supernovahs
Content: correctly

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: Did you import the ethers-rs `Provider` trait by mistake (maybe via the prelude)?

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: if you don't need the ether-rs `Provider` trait, just import the `starknet-rs` trait instead.

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: if you _do_ need to use the 2 different provider traits at the same time, you need to use a more verbose syntax

Author: _dsi
Content: Yeah I need both, what do you mean by a more "verbose" syntax ?

Author: _dsi
Content: Changing the name ?

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: Nah you need to explicitly use the trait function. Changing name won't help. But this is only needed when the function name clashes, and this doesn't seem to be the case here.

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: that same function is named `block_number` in starknet-rs

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: not `get_block_number` so you don't have clash here

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: but generally speaking, when you _do_ get a clash between traits, just do something like this:

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: https://github.com/xJonathanLEI/starknet-rs/blob/655af56a585d892b08a44f3d91f802ea489b28b8/starknet-providers/src/any.rs#L69_L72

Author: _dsi
Content: Yeah it's basically what I was doing

Author: _dsi
Content:
But with the `block_number` method I get 
```
no method named `block_number` found for reference `&starknet::providers::SequencerGatewayProvider` in the current scope
items from traits can only be used if the trait is in scope
```

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: Because `div` can be ambiguous. Does it mean integer division or finite field division?

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: So there's `floor_div()` instead.

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: If you're using the `starknet` crate, you can use the `felt!()` macro to initialize `FieldElement` at compile time.

Author: xjonathanlei
Content: It takes both decimal and hexadecimal representations and computes mont input for you so you don't have to.

Author: .kmarklor
Content:
Hello,
how do I declare and deploy a contract on a local devtest?

Author: .kmarklor
Content:
I cannot declare the contract on the local node because it requires a descriptor account file which cannot be created by `starkli account <Var> init ./path/` i guess because `starkli account fetch` returns "account is not deployed" because this command only looks at chain-deployed accounts.
The problem with `starkli account <Var> init ./path/` is the error which says that "the account is not deployed" while the local node considers it as de facto deployed.

Author: glihm
Content: You're talking about katana devnode or the testnet? Check first running `starkliup` to ensure you have the latest version of the tool. Same for the devnet/katana. (For katana, you must use the nightly version for now as some fixed has been pushed to it: `dojoup -v nightly`).

Author: anoushk
Content: is there any way to generate an sdk from a starknet contract

Author: anoushk
Content: similar to this https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/tree/master/examples/contracts#generating-rust-bindings-with-abigen

Author: anoushk
Content: @Jonathan LEI

Author: anoushk
Content: also when i fetch some data from starknet provider i get something like this, how do i parse this?

Author: anoushk
glihm
Content: Yep there is some work on-going to explore this taking in account the cairo generic types. üëç Not directly in starknet-rs for now, but we'll see how it evolves!

Author: glihm
Content: For now doing a raw call like this, you'll have to parse the felts based on the contract code. So you can take it's ABI to know what's supposed to be returned, or directly from the contract cairo code if it's your code.

Author: glihm
Content: With the ABI parser that will write some rust code to handle your cairo structs, it will be easier to parse them. üëç  But for now it's manual.

Author: anoushk
Content: is there any example code for this @glihm

Author: glihm
Content:
Hum well it very depends on your contract and your functions.

But we just release a more advanced version of the abi gen: https://github.com/glihm/starknet-abigen-rs

We will do the events this weekend or next week. But now you can:

1. Generate the bindings from your ABI.
2. Serialize/Deserialize any cairo type including your own structs/enums (they can be generic too).
3. You can do calls/invoke directly from the generated code.

Examples here in the repo: https://github.com/glihm/starknet-abigen-rs/blob/main/src/main.rs

Author: anoushk
glihm
Content:
This is what we try to build with abigen and hopefully it will become part of `starknet-rs` itself.

If you want to do the deserialization yourself, you'll have to parse the `verifier_data` and verify you have the correct values to then create your struct.

Or using abi generation you can directly do like this:
```rust
let verifier_data: VerifierData = your_contract.getVerifier();
``` 
You first need to generate the binding from your ABI. For this you can check the README here https://github.com/glihm/starknet-abigen-rs. üëç

Author: anoushk
Content: So to do this manually(without abigen) there‚Äôs no example for this?

Author: anoushk
Content: Been trying to find other projects on GitHub that do this but haven‚Äôt found anything

Author: glihm
glihm
Content: This is what abigen does for you, with type checking + serialization/deserialization when the call it's done.
